A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
TLJ finally pushes the Star Wars story forward. It's literally the first movie in 30 years that's looking to the future of the series instead of rehashing the past. 

And just because your convoluted Snoke theory didn't pan out\, doesn't mean the movie sucked. And giving an iconic character a more complicated and dynamic arc isn't betraying his legacy\, it's making it better. 

Only complaint is the Finn storyline which is kinda shoehorned in just to give him something to do. Hopefully he's given something more consequential in IX.
